event: First European contact by Spanish explorer Juan Díaz de Solís
Portuguese establish Colonia del Sacramento, disputed with Spanish
Montevideo founded by the Spanish to counter Portuguese influence
José Gervasio Artigas leads rebellion against Spanish rule
Portuguese forces from Brazil invade and occupy Uruguay
Thirty-Three Orientals declare independence from Brazil
Treaty of Montevideo brokered by Britain recognizes Uruguay’s independence
First constitution adopted; establishment of the Republic of Uruguay
Uruguayan Civil War (Guerra Grande) begins between Blancos and Colorados
End of prolonged civil conflict; political stability improves
José Batlle y Ordóñez becomes president; introduces major reforms
President Gabriel Terra stages a self-coup and suspends constitution
Uruguay adopts a collegiate executive system (National Council of Government)
Presidential system reinstated by new constitution
Military dictatorship begins after a coup against President Bordaberry
Return to democracy with Julio María Sanguinetti as president
Tabaré Vázquez becomes first leftist president in modern history
José Mujica, former guerrilla leader, elected president
Luis Lacalle Pou elected president, return of center-right government
